alert.note: Alert for Cheatham; Davidson; Dickson; Hickman; Robertson; Sumner; Williamson (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 21 at 6:27PM CDT by NWS Nashville
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Davidson, eastern Dickson, western Sumner, northwestern Williamson, Cheatham, northeastern Hickman and Robertson Counties through 715 PM CDT... At 626 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 7 miles northwest of Coopertown to 7 miles southwest of Fairview. Movement was east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Franklin, Springfield, Ashland City, Nashville, Madison, Hendersonville, Brentwood, Goodlettsville, White House, Millersville, Greenbrier, Forest Hills, Oak Hill, Coopertown, White Bluff, Belle Meade, Kingston Springs, Pegram, Ridgetop and Cross Plains. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for Middle Tennessee.

area.areaDesc: Cheatham; Davidson; Dickson; Hickman; Robertson; Sumner; Williamson
